definitions: A certification indicating that an individual has met specific requirements and demonstrated proficiency in medical coding, particularly using the Current Procedural Terminology (CPT) code set.
A professional designation for individuals qualified to assign CPT codes to medical services and procedures for billing and record-keeping purposes.
examples: She earned her CPT credential last year.
Many employers require a CPT credential for medical coders.
Maintaining a CPT credential often involves continuing education.
